title: CNES to Test Upgraded FROG Reusable Rocket Demonstrator in 2025
summary: The French space agency CNES will begin flight testing a small reusable rocket demonstrator called FROG-H in 2025. In 2017, CNES launched its Rocket for GNC demonstration (FROG) project, aiming to test landing algorithms for reusable launch vehicles. The agency also utilized the project to pursue a “break from traditional development methods.” According to CNES, […]

title: Northrop Grumman unveils flying data center for military intelligence
summary: The airborne system is designed to collect and process real-time data from satellites, drones, ground and maritime sensors

title: Argotec inaugurates new satellite factory
summary: Italian smallsat manufacturer Argotec formally opened a new manufacturing facility that will allow it to increase its production rate while it looks at new business opportunities in Europe and the United States.

title: The evolution of the Space Force in an increasingly commercial space age
summary: The U.S. Space Force is mandated to “organize, train and equip” forces to protect American interests in space. That sounds straightforward on paper. In practice, however, the very definition of […]

title: Student-led Group Performs Europe’s First Reusable Rocket Hop
summary: A reusable rocket demonstrator built by a group of students from the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Lausanne in Switzerland has successfully completed a 105-metre free flight. The Gruyère Space Program (GSP) was created in 2018 with the goal of developing a small 2.5-metre reusable rocket demonstrator called Colibri. The demonstrator is powered by the […]

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy October 20-26, 2024
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of October 20-26, 2024 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in recess...

title: SpaceX launches 20 spare satellites for rival OneWeb LEO constellation
summary: SpaceX launched 20 spare OneWeb satellites Oct. 20 to strengthen the resiliency of French operator Eutelsat’s low Earth orbit broadband network.

title: Intelsat 33e breaks up in geostationary orbit
summary: The Intelsat 33e satellite has broken up in geostationary orbit and lost power, ceasing communications services for customers across Europe, Africa and parts of Asia Pacific

title: Latest Starship flight prompts praise and worries at IAC
summary: For many of the more than 11,000 participants at the International Astronautical Congress this year, the biggest news of the week-long conference was not anything that took place within the sprawling convention center here but instead more than 9,000 kilometers away.

title: SpaceX launches final Gen. 1 OneWeb satellites on 100th orbital flight of 2024
summary: With this mission, SpaceX has now launched 98 Falcon 9 rockets and two Falcon Heavy rockets this year. Liftoff of the OneWeb #20 mission happened at 10:13 p.m. PDT (1:13 a.m. EDT, 0513 UTC).
